website_summaries.verdict: If you've got allergies or pets, this is a great choice. An incredibly effective filter for a reasonable price.
pros: Draws in dirt like a magnet, thanks to electrostatic filter
Filters out very small dust particles
cons: Can be overwhelmed by too many particles in the air
you might have to replace it often

customer_reviews.title: Product has been downgraded
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered these same filters several times and have been happy in the past. When they arrived this time, they were not the same. These are much more flimsy, and while the frame itself is 1", the filter inside seems much thinner as well. I guess I'll have to find myself another source for furnace filters.
customer_reviews.author: Pandora

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit
customer_reviews.text: These appear to be counterfeit. The webbing design is different, labels different, filter material has a completely different texture. Much flimsier. Packaging is not standard either.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: What a shame, now complete garbage!!
customer_reviews.text: This was my fifth purchase of these filters, until this order the filters were decent. Unfortunately now they are loose floppy mess. The frame lacks the support needed to keep these in place. Very dissapointed and unless changes are made to reverse this travesty of what can only be called "value engineering" or cost driven design change my household and 7 other family memebers housholds will no longer purchase any Nordic pure products.
customer_reviews.author: Rocket

customer_reviews.title: Merv 11 is not marked and quality is substandard
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a case of the merv11. Nothing on the box nor filters indicates a merv rating. Based on my experience with name brand filters of the same merv these are not nearly the same quality. I have dust allergies and this filter doesn’t compare. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: M McCormick

customer_reviews.title: El Cheapo cardboard frames -- had to throw away
customer_reviews.text: Wirecutter had praised the Nordic filters. But the cardboard frame is so flimsy and insubstantial that it folded when I pushed it into the slot. The slot is snug on my furnace but I never had that trouble with any other brand of filter -- and I've never bought expensive brands. $40 down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Irvin King

customer_reviews.title: no way of knowing if it is truely MERV 14 rating
customer_reviews.text: Nowhere on the box or the filters do it say the merv rating of 14. There is an area both on the box and Filter the say MERV ______. But no 14. Very disappointed. Returning
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Allison

customer_reviews.title: Not Nordic Pure
customer_reviews.text: These are not sealed and have no labels. I feel they are genetic filters sent in a generic Nordic Pure box. Has no MERV rating or other info on the box so I you don't know if you actually got what you ordered, but they look generic quality to me. Also they aren't the 16x25x1, I should've read more than the first 2 reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Quality has diminished GREATLY
customer_reviews.text: These may still work as well but likely not. My order from 6 months ago - each filter wrapped in plastic and pure white. These were all in a box together (6 filters) and they look grey. Now I have to find ANOTHER manufacturer who doesn't mess with their product continually by cheapening it and making the C suite people richer. Extremely annoying trend in business. - low quality high prices and PO'd consumers.
customer_reviews.author: DMitten

customer_reviews.title: Exactly the same as another vendor's MERV 11 filters...
customer_reviews.text: I just got these MERV 14 filters, and they look identical to and have the same markings on them as does THIS other vendor MERV 11 filter set ( Meaning, they appear to the same filters but are being sold in boxes by multiple vendors with different ratings on them. This was a lot of $$$ for filters that may not even be MERV 14! I do not know how well they will work. I just installed one and will come back and revise/update based on performance.
customer_reviews.author: a.k.a. Geek Girl

customer_reviews.title: You probably don't replace your furnace filters often enough.  This helps.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried three brands of online filters in the MERV 12-13 range, and keep coming back to Nordic Pure. They hold their shape, they clearly catch a LOT of airborne crud, they don't restrict flow much, they're consistent, they're fairly priced. I like that they come in a sturdy cardboard box and aren't individually plastic-wrapped. Especially in the COVID era when people are working from home much more, paying attention to your air quality matters -- and always having good quality filters (like these) on hand helps.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Paxton

customer_reviews.title: Questionable quality
customer_reviews.text: The 6 filters come without any labels that show that these are MERV 12 filters. I specifically needed a safe filters to protect me from the dust and pollen. But there is no sign on the packaging nor filters themselves that they adhere to MERV 12 standards. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: A. Buran

customer_reviews.title: These are not MERV 10 filters
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a box of 16x25x1 MERV 10 filters for my home furnace. I am a mechanical (hvac) design engineer. These are not MERV 10 filters, very cheap product. Not a single label anywhere identifying it. I question if they are even made by NordicPure. Buy a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Marrone

customer_reviews.title: good product, but crushed in transit
customer_reviews.text: some were damaged in transit but didn't effect the quality. we have two dogs and since i switched to an amazing filter, I have had a dramatic decrease in allergies. I thank my husband for telling me to buy good ones because I am cheap... it is WELL worth it and still, i priced these everywhere and these are actually a super great deal for what you get also. I will buy these again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Grace Wright

customer_reviews.title: Design Change Made Filters Bendy
customer_reviews.text: I have included some side by side photos of a filter from my last order and my most recent. This most recent set was not in a white Nordic box but rather bagged up in a plain cardboard box. Also, no markings on the filter sides. No support on one side of filter so it warped and bent when inserting into the furance. Looks like there was a cost reduction design change.
customer_reviews.author: sicst9

customer_reviews.title: Drop in quality
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this a few times since I have liked their quality for the price. For some reason I received flimsy looking filters that felt very basic when I opened them. They were also delivered in a generic box unlike a Nordic box in the past. Returned them yesterday.
customer_reviews.author: Kaushal Vyas

customer_reviews.title: Best Product For The Money
customer_reviews.text: Used the MERV 10 to replace a MERV 8. No issues with restrictions whatsoever during the last month of usage. Air is clean coming out. Just pulled it out to view and its catching my dog's dander & hair. I think this IS the best value for an house HVAC air filter. I am happy with this product. Btw, you should mark the side with the replacement date, and mark the outside of the box with installation dates. This will help you keep track of how often you should replace the filter. How often? There are many factors that affect the answer, from how many ppl are in the house, to pets, to cooking, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Ran

customer_reviews.title: Neither box nor product has MERV rating ANYWHERE
customer_reviews.text: Inside the top flap of the box, the side flap has spot marked "MERV: " that should contain the MERV rating stamped at the factory, but nothing is marked. The filters themselves contain no MERV ratings marks. Looking at the material under a magnifier, I can't believe this is MERV14 when compared to the Filtrete filters I have been using that have an alleged MERV rating of 12.
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: Doubtfully MERV 14
customer_reviews.text: The filter media is thin and there are obvious penetrations. For basic dust (large particle) filtering this would probably be fine. But if you are buying a MERV 14 filter you are probably trying to capture micron or sub micron size particles. As an engineer, I’m skeptical what I was shipped would actually achieve MERV 14 performance. If you are buying these to repurpose the filter media/fabric (for a DIY face mask, etc.) the metal mesh and cardboard structure are well adhered with glue which makes disassembly pretty much impossible. Not a design flaw by any means if you are using it as a furnace filter.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: was waiting for these since it was time to change furnace filter. It's a bit flimsier than my normal brand, but a lot less pricy. You get 6 for the price of four. I can say that since I installed it, I am no longer coughing all day. A solid 4 star product for me. I took away a star because they are a bit flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Honesty Matters

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time purchase of this brand, what a disappointment. Filtering material is so thin it's practically see-through. But biggest problem is they have a perfumey fragrance! I buy filters with charcoal to diminish odors, not add some artificial fragrance. I took 3 out of the box and left them sitting around, propped up so both sides of filter were uncovered and exposed to air, in hope that the fragrance might dissipate after airing them out. A month later, nope, they still smell. And now it's past the return window, so $65 literally in the trash cuz I threw them out.
customer_reviews.author: Linda B.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap filters that work okay
customer_reviews.text: I bought these on a whim because they were less expensive than the regular brand I buy. I have pretty bad allergies and my normal filters would last me 2 months before I started noticing I need to change it. These were close to 4-5 weeks. They worked well enough but it was still cheaper to buy the other brand I normally buy.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Rader

customer_reviews.title: Love these filters !
customer_reviews.text: Received my "6 pack" today ! Arrived on time and in perfect condition. I have used these filters in the past and they work as well as the Filtrete Ultra at a much lower cost. There has been some discussion regarding the sizing of this filter. Notice the description states; "actual size 15 1/2 x 24 1/2 x 3⁄4". I also noticed on the 3M Filtrete Ultra states in Technical Details; "Product Dimensions 15.7 x 24.7 x 0.8 inches". This is the reason the U.S.A. must switch over to metric sizing. When was the last time anyone bought a real 2x4? Caveat Emptor !!
customer_reviews.author: Franzie

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: We have bought from Nordic in the past with good results. However, the quality of filters from this last order was terrible. They are soo flimsy, I have had difficulty removing it from the furnace after a 90 day use. It came out in pieces. Without warning Nordic must have altered their source with total disregard for quality. Of course the price was the same. This was a ripoff.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne H

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged, unbranded, dubious MERV
customer_reviews.text: While the outer box is clearly Nordic Pure branded, it's also clearly been opened and re-sealed - the contents were heavily damaged (at least 2 completely unusable. The filters themselves have *no* Nordic Pure labeling *at all*, and no mention of MERV or MPR rating. The pleats-per-inch are roughly 1/4 of the density of a Filtrete MERV-12 I replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Doubting Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: We live in a small old house in Florida (about 1200 sq ft built in the 50s). Florida is a moldy humid place, especially in the Summer. And we have 2 cats. I already buy the best litter in the world and we have a dehumidifier but I wanted to improve the air quality. Within a few days we could tell the difference. Now we don't get hit with a moldy, closed up house smell when we walk in. I will use these forever. This really helps. I am very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: LeLu

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and nicely priced
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying these for several years now, for two furnaces. They work very well in a home with several kids and hairy pets; I change them out monthly and invariably lots of fine pet hair, dust, and other gunk is trapped in them that we'd otherwise be recirculating. The box of 12 is very sturdy (for shipping) and contains the individual filters unwrapped, which I like to reduce packaging waste. The individual filters are also quite robust, and can stand being pushed into tight filter rails. The price is quite a bit lower than comparable (MERV8) filters I find in the big box stores. I intend to keep buying these, and would highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick E.

customer_reviews.title: Comparable to Filtrete, but much less cost!
customer_reviews.text: I need an air filter with a higher MERV rating to keep the dust and allergens down. It is great at trapping all of the little particles! I have a dog that sheds a lot, so I find that I must replace this filter about every 6 weeks or so. The cost of these filters runs about $11 each, which is FAR cheaper than the higher MERV Filtrete air filters. This is especially true when I have to replace any brand of air filter sooner then the recommended 3 months!
customer_reviews.author: DoreenT

customer_reviews.title: No indication or marking that this is MERV 14
customer_reviews.text: Nothing on or in the box indicates that these are MERV 14. Even the place on the box of 12 that says MERV and next to it a space for indicating the MERV number is left empty. The picture in the product page in amazon where every filter shows MERV 14 is not there. Filters are not individually rapped. For all I now they could be there cheapest filters. This is the first and last time I buy this make. Avoid!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Downgraded product.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve ordered these for years. In my most recent - November 2019 shipment they changed the product!! Very flimsy now. DO NOT ORDER THESE. Hopefully they change back.
customer_reviews.author: Galen Mason

customer_reviews.title: Don't cheap out, change your filters.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a home, and the first thing our real estate agent said to do was "change the filters". I ordered these on Amazon, based on their MERV rating and they were delivered promptly. When I replaced the old filter, it was a box store basic filter that you could see through. The new filter made a noticeable change in our air quality, no more dust.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for the money & excellent customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Filters are a good value. I've been buying the MERV 12 for years and they do an excellent job of filtering. Recently I called customer service to determine if a MERV 8 would be adequate for my needs. The CSR did an excellent job of explaining the differences and the impact on my Unit. After hearing the explanation I decided to try the MERV 8 to see if it works as well w/my unit & small house
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Product is nothing like pictures
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these filters based on past experience and quality but this time, they look nothing like the pictures advertised. They are obviously cheaper and less sturdy. I’ll keep them only because I need to replace used filter. I won’t be ordering again.
customer_reviews.author: jw543

customer_reviews.title: It WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking to upgrade my furnace filters for a couple of years. With a current home built in the 1870s, it's a given that the place is going to have dust, especially in the older parts of the flue system.. I have been pleasantly surprised at how this filter (along with Nordic pure filters on the vents) have significantly cut down on dust and other allergens. I'm so glad I ordered the 6 pack. I've been come a big fan of Nordic Pure and would recommend these to anyone, especially if a family member has pulmonary or allergy issues.
customer_reviews.author: rms

customer_reviews.title: Great to have on hand
customer_reviews.text: Having a quantity of these to change out monthly helps keep our home cleaner. We are in the process of renovation, so there's a lot of dust flying, despite our best effiorts to contain it. I store the box of them in the air return and they are out of the way. Buying in quantity makes it all easier. Much better price than the big box stores.
customer_reviews.author: Karuna

customer_reviews.title: Good deal. Comparable to home deport version.
customer_reviews.text: I used these in my condo. Replaced size wise the one in the unit just fine. My unit (800 square feet) is pretty airtight. I have 2.5 pmi sensor. And it lowered the count from 150 to 20 in two hours (with the fan recirculating and with windows all closed). I was going to buy a standalone hepa unit but I think the pure filters will do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: pixel_pusher

customer_reviews.title: Good filter Bad packaging.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a few times. Very disappointed that on the third purchase only received 5 not 6 in the box. Almost impossible to figure out how to notify customer service at Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: C. Terrey

customer_reviews.title: Good solution for us
customer_reviews.text: We’ve ordered these a couple of times and have been happy with them each time. A good, basic filter that won’t excessively restrict flow and in a multipack so I do change it out once a month. Was tired of not finding the size we needed and the ridiculous price buying 1 or 2 at a time in the big box stores.
customer_reviews.author: ElaineW

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t remove allergies or dust.
customer_reviews.text: Awful, my allergies are bad and I have to dust every two days. Doesn’t remove any of this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: Smoke free!!
customer_reviews.text: We are in the PNW and we're affected by the giant cloud of smoke from the california fires. We changed our filters twice with these. They were extremely fuzzy with smoke. Our house stayed smoke free, which is awesome because one of our kiddos has asthma. Will keep these on my to buy list!
customer_reviews.author: leilani hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Nice filter and a better value!
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with these filters. They are much cheaper to buy here online then the more expensive ones at the home improvement stores. I think they work just as well and have had no issues. I used to use 3M and I tested these and the 3M equivalent for 30 days over the winter months (so pollen and open windows wouldn't be an issue) and found that they both looked exactly the same after 30 days, so I'm satisfied. I would recommend...
customer_reviews.author: RonS

customer_reviews.title: Labeling?
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed that nowhere on the product packaging or the product itself does it actually say Merv 12. Pricing was okay but the above fact may negate that also.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: If you know what properly rated Merv standards are, you will be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a Merv 14, was sent a lie. There were less pleats, less depth and more paper support structure blocking airflow, compared to known properly rated filters. If you want to use this filter, don’t bother with the higher Merv ratings. Based on what I have seen so far, the company is truly just ripping the customers off.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Carlisle

customer_reviews.title: Very well made at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: These filters arrived packaged in a sturdy cardboard box. The filters are probably the best filters I have used in 25 years of being a homeowner. The filter media seems dense and compact and catches all the dust and other things. The air coming from the vents is much cleaner as we don't seem to be sick as often. The dust build up is also much less. The best things is the price, more than half what the big name home improvement stores are charging for a comparable filter. Very happy with the money savings.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: You Need to Take Air Quality Seriously.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't bother to look into air filters until I got a sinus infection that lasted 90+ days. I have some allergies but I never thought of myself as prone to colds and flus. I was changing my standard 3M furnace filters right on schedule. But the problem is I didn't do my homework and wasn't aware of just how many allergens the cheap furnace filters don't even begin to filter out. Switching to the heavy duty MERV 12 rated filters has made a huge difference in the air quality in my house, and I'm feel better for it!
customer_reviews.author: M. M. Rizzo

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic price!  Why order just one?!?!
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of forgetting to replace my furnace filter, and remembering way too late. By ordering six (and saving a fortune) I now trip over the box in my utility closet each time I go in there, and "poof" the light bulb dings over my head and I remember to change the filter. As an added bonus, my house is cleaner too! These filters seem to catch ALL of the dog hair that flies around my house, and store it for safe keeping in the filter.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan W

customer_reviews.title: but for the filtration quality these are amazing. The cost per filter is also very good
customer_reviews.text: Expensive, but for the filtration quality these are amazing. The cost per filter is also very good. I purchased these because the owner of the house had replaced the filter approximately never and I was looking to remove most of the dust moving around the house and being circulated by the incredibly dirty filter so I went up several purity levels higher than a house would realistically need.
customer_reviews.author: Jason B

customer_reviews.title: It's an air filter... what did you expect?!
customer_reviews.text: It works great and I use mine for anywhere between 30 to 45 days before replacing. With the cost being cheaper and good value, you can afford to switch them out a little more frequently. Overall they do a nice job. But if you are getting overly excited reading a review about air filters, you probably need some better hobbies in life.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J. Reinhart

customer_reviews.title: Best Price/Quality
customer_reviews.text: These work great for my home. After extensive comparison shopping online and at stores, I decided to give these a shot because of the price and reviews. I could not be more happy. USA made, great quality, great filtration. I have been using Nordic air for about 3 years now. I am a happy repeat customer. Just got another Box of 6. I change them every 2-3 months to keep super fresh air. 5 Stars.
customer_reviews.author: C J M

customer_reviews.title: High quality filter for superb price
customer_reviews.text: Everything came shipped in a large box (protection), which is paramount for items such as filters. This price was incredible, especially since Nordic is constantly rated as one of the best filters. Quit wasting money at local stores (HD/wholesalers, etc) - Buy this multipack for next to nothing knowing you’ve got an incredible filter!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: After much research
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't purchase anything rated under a MERV 6 (especially anything that's ultra cheap), but I don't notice the payoff for very high rated options with all the bells and whistles considering the premium you pay. This is a happy medium and price point/quality compared to other brands seems very good.
customer_reviews.author: Bibi

customer_reviews.title: so far so good, replaced with arm and hammer ones I got, replace every 30 days
customer_reviews.text: so far it seems to keep filter cleaner longer. we just got a new puppy so door has been open more and hard to compare but for the price difference I think it's a great product with a good merv rating to block out smaller particulates. would recommend so far.
customer_reviews.author: Dabloesco

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade from the cheap stuff
customer_reviews.text: This made our HVAC run a bit quieter compared to the cheapy ones I had in there previous. Needed to upgrade due to covid precautions and think these high grade filters will add another layer of protection
customer_reviews.author: explainer guy

customer_reviews.title: Wrong product in box
customer_reviews.text: This is my third time ordering this item and did so a few months ago. The first two times when I received the proper item I’d give it a 5 star rating. I enjoyed the quality so much I bought ahead because I thought it was great quality at a great price. I just opened a new box of 6 filters and it’s the wrong product so I gave it a 1 star. These are incredibly flimsy and horrible quality. It’s also past the return window so I’m stuck with overpriced crap filters. Hopefully the seller sees this and makes it right. These ones were so flimsy I had to fight just to get it into the furnace.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Treynor

customer_reviews.title: Great filters at a fraction of local prices.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I was tired of paying $15 each for filters of a lesser rating from my local overpriced home improvement center. My wife and I have allergies. I swap out my furnace filter every 3 months. At this price I don't try to push it to 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: jlasersmith

customer_reviews.title: No
customer_reviews.text: They are a tiny bit bigger than specified and don't fit in the slot easily. They get crushed when forced into the designated space. I will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Michelin K.

customer_reviews.title: Buy these and thank me later
customer_reviews.text: I always hated turning on the forced hot air furnace because my eyes would run and nose would plug up but after running my furnace with these filters that's all went away and the air smells cleaner. I highly recommend these if you or someone in your family has allergies. Thank me later👍
customer_reviews.author: Lordzables

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and value but beware of fakes
customer_reviews.text: These filters are excellent, but make sure you only buy them New, directly from Amazon. I ordered a set of filters from Amazon Warehouse as there was no New stock available and received a fake product. Nordic Pure carbon filters have the carbon impregnated within the pleats of the filter, the fake ones were clearly regular filters with a carbon filter later added on top.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: I swapped out my old filter and suddenly it smelled like fresh snow falling
customer_reviews.text: I could smell a difference in the air immediately after I changed my filter! I'm not even kidding. I swapped out my old filter and suddenly it smelled like fresh snow falling, or clean sheets hanging on the line. It's lovely. I highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Fred Said

customer_reviews.title: Good price/performance balance
customer_reviews.text: These are reasonably priced for 90 day filters. I noticed the small coverage gap that others have mentioned. My HVAC guy didn’t seem like it was a problem when he did the semi annual checks.
customer_reviews.author: Bob M.

customer_reviews.title: Appear to do the job, shipping issues
customer_reviews.text: Arrived fast and as described. Fit and seem to work well. I docked a star because: 1. No instructions. I think I got the correct side facing the furnace, but not entirely sure. 2. USPS left shipping box in rain so box was wet. Luckily just a drizzle, so did not reach the filters, but suggest wrapping them in plastic for shipment. If they got wet I would have to return.
customer_reviews.author: SLG

customer_reviews.title: Not well made
customer_reviews.text: The filters don't seem to have much quality control. Their size is not consistent - I have to squeeze a few to fit the 12 X 36 opening. Worse, though, is that they whistle. Very disturbing when trying to get a good night's sleep.
customer_reviews.author: MMeyer

customer_reviews.title: These are fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Used these during the wild fires and they took so many smoke particles out of our house air. Black in just a day. I'm going to use these all the time now. They remove many more particles than regular filters.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is off.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 16x25x1, their product is trimmed all the way around by a half inch. If I order a specific size that is what I expect. This will not work in my furnace it will get sucked into the blower. Such a waste of time will return. The least Nordic Pure could do is make a product that works but obviously that is too much to ask.
customer_reviews.author: B Russell B

customer_reviews.title: A great buy!
customer_reviews.text: We just started using these filters this year and I took the first one out after being used for a long California summer. It appeared to work just as advertised. My sister is asthmatic and never seems to have any problems when she is over visiting. This is a much more affordable option compared to the brands at the big box store chains. Also, I love having a box of them handy so that I can set a reminder on my phone to swap these out twice a year and not have to worry about running to the store to get the task off my honey-do list.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ingram

customer_reviews.title: Lately too much MERV for my 5 years old unit.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for 2 years now but lately MERV rating has been too hard on my HVAC. It works fine as far as the airflow but my 5 years old HVAC sounds like it is struggling to get the air moving. I have reduced to MERV 8 while keeping the same brand.
customer_reviews.author: Denzil Khine

customer_reviews.title: Price, Performance, What's not to love?!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for! I'm a do it yourselfer, and so I service my own furnace... Disassemble the burners, clean them, inspect the pilot light, make sure the belt is tracking and tightened properly, etc. When I saw these I thought, nah I've always used another brand. But the price lured me in and they work just as good, if not better than the name brand! I really like the packaging and install exactly like the premium filter! Looking forward to years of service from my furnace and a ton of cleaner air! Thanks Nordic Pure!
customer_reviews.author: Snixer

customer_reviews.title: Filters seem to be well made, except for the ...
customer_reviews.text: Filters seem to be well made, except for the size. I ordered the 1"x16"x25" filters, but they are barely 151/2" in height. The window to return them has closed, so I will keep them and just rip a 1/2" shim out of some left over hardwood I have from a home remodeling project, and go ahead and use them. I will NOT reorder these again.
customer_reviews.author: Ultrared

customer_reviews.title: Not Merv 13
customer_reviews.text: These are not Merv 13 fikters, they are sub standard. The pleats are like a cheap low Merv filter. The Merv rating isnt on the product. The wire frame the fikter sits on is protruding through the fikter material.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kaynem

customer_reviews.title: Nice Filters
customer_reviews.text: Very nice filters. Fast Shipping. I don’t know what some people are talking about damaged boxes and filters and receiving filters in a brown box. I received mine in a NP white box with a MERV 12 written on the box.
customer_reviews.author: Miles A. Kudo

customer_reviews.title: A excellent product
customer_reviews.text: It has performed as good, if not better than the much more expensive 3m product of the same filtration rating. Will not go back to 3m product any more. This product is also made in the US. An equally superior product but less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Richard H. Ho

customer_reviews.title: Not standard size!
customer_reviews.text: Filter is priced really well and seems to be good quality, have only had filter installed for a few days so I can’t speak to the long term quality. However they are not standard size. It does state the actual size in the description but that’s not industry standard, what’s the point of having a high MERV rating if air leaks all around the sides?!?!?
customer_reviews.author: Justin Mahoney

customer_reviews.title: Best filter out there.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best air filter. Our family has bad allergies and I have to breathe in quality air due to some lung health issues I have. These by far have been the best filter for our home for all of us. I will continue to buy this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Barlas Yuce

customer_reviews.title: smaller than advertised. doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: the filters are smaller than advertised. I compared them with 3M filters from Costco and used a tape measure (see pics) and found they were not as advertised. the first of 5 filters worked well but the second hasn't held up and doesn't even work. hopefully it can still be returned
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Works and is a good price
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this brand in the last two houses and have not been disappointed in the quality or the price. Like that I can easily buy them by the box and not have to worry about it every month or two.
customer_reviews.author: Princess

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy filters
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these filters for the past 5 years. I made the mistake of trying a cheaper alternative, which broke apart in my furnace. I went back to Nordic Pure because they are sturdy and are priced well.
customer_reviews.author: wargski25

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been buying another brand and the cardboard framing seemed flimsy. They would bend from the pressure of the air blowing through them. These seem a little stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Rayne

customer_reviews.title: Well-constructed, and very good value.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this brand air filter for many years. I don't use high MERV filters because I don't need them, and they do put more stress on the blower motor. Much more cost-effective than the big box stores.
customer_reviews.author: Derek244

customer_reviews.title: Undersized and thin
customer_reviews.text: They're undersized and thin. I replace them every 2 months rather than every 3 or more months with other brands I've used, as they start to billow out due to the air pressure/flow after only a month or so. I won't be buying these again, although they are a decent deal.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and fits very well.
customer_reviews.text: This fits my return air duct opening a lot better than 3m filters of the same size. And the 2 sides cardboard frame made it more sturdy than 3M filters.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa W.

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal!
customer_reviews.text: This sure beats the cost of getting a GOOD filter at any home improvement or hardware store. I always prefer to use the local businesses when I can, but the price of these filters in the stores is outrageous! This brand works great, fits perfectly, and at a price where I can afford a box of them, instead of having to run to a store. When it's time to replace the filter, I just go out to the garage and pull another out of the box. I checked with my A/C-furnace guy, and he said that the MERV 10 rating on this model is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great for summer
customer_reviews.text: I really like these, and they seem to be a better value than in-store brands. I Use MERV 7 in the summer, but in the winter feel like that's too much filtration and need to go with something smaller.
customer_reviews.author: dugroz

customer_reviews.title: Collapses under pressure
customer_reviews.text: So weakly made they collapse under the pressure of air flow. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Fotini D.

customer_reviews.title: buyer beware!!
customer_reviews.text: the size is 1/4 to 1/2 inch smaller and there is no way to verify the quality. MERV13 is supposed at MRP1900 or above. see photos comparing nordic pure's MERV13 TO fliterate MRP1500.
customer_reviews.author: A. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good filter but wrong size in box!!
customer_reviews.text: Although the construction appears very good I was disappointed by the fact that when I finally opened the box I see they packaged the wrong filter size. As you can see from the pictures I ordered one size and the box is marked as such. It was several months later before I needed the filters so when I opened the box and found the wrong filter inside it was too late to return them. Four stars for construction minus one star for poor quality control and packing.
customer_reviews.author: Noel Hastings

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for my old school and defunct electrostatic air filter.
customer_reviews.text: I had to yank the two old, heavy, and useless metal air filters and replace with the Nordic filter. The fit is great and I have not noticed any impacts to the air flow in our central AC system. The two technicians from different companies who inspected my system recommended it. I'm glad I took their advice. The filters are reasonably priced and have been meeting my expectations so far. These require replacement every 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: CU

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Nordic Pure 16x25x1 MERV 12 Pleated AC Furnace Air Filter, Box of 6 are a great value and work well to filter air throughout the house.
customer_reviews.author: Blford

customer_reviews.title: Better than 3-M.
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these. I have always used the 3-M products, but have found that these clean the air so much better. The 3-M product I would still have to dust once a week, with these, even with a dog in the house a living on a busy street, I now only have to dust every two weeks. No going back to 3-M for me.
customer_reviews.author: MoBee

customer_reviews.title: Seems fine
customer_reviews.text: Fit and function of filter seems fine after use for a couple of years. I have pets and run the fan all the time so filter gets changed every 45 days. price for the stated Merv rating is hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Loanbandit

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Always used 3m brand. I had a steel brace to prevent this from sucking in. These are much stiffer where I probably wouldn't need that. Make it harder to install in my furnace but it has a weird set up. One with an actual filter box would have no issues. I expect the filtration to be at least on par.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas M.

customer_reviews.title: Too restrictive for my needs...
customer_reviews.text: This MERV 13 was too restrictive in air flow. The air flow coming out of my registers were not strong. These work great in filtering but it was not doing my furnaces (2 zones) any justice in making them work harder. The MERV perfect for my needs is 12. If you have allergies and have pets or just have a house that collects a lot of dust, then MERV 13 might be for you. This brand name is inexpensive and it does very well in filtering compared to the expensive brands out there.
customer_reviews.author: D. C. O.

customer_reviews.title: Better price
customer_reviews.text: These are a better price than the home improvement store that I normally go to and they are just a smidge smaller with help getting them in and out of the slot.
customer_reviews.author: Mad Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Great House HVAC Filters
customer_reviews.text: These are high quality filters that are better priced and better made than the ones I used to buy at the home improvement stores.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Valdes

customer_reviews.title: I recently got a new roommate who has a cat and this has really helped me feel like I can cut down on some of the effects ...
customer_reviews.text: Instantly could tell the difference in my house! I recently got a new roommate who has a cat and this has really helped me feel like I can cut down on some of the effects of the cat being in the lower level 100% of the time. I also feel, for the price, I will be more apt to change my filters on time or more regularly! Great buy, IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley N. Schulte

customer_reviews.title: Nordic Pure MERV 10 Furnace Filter
customer_reviews.text: I like Nordic Pure filters since I've been using them for several years. Very good quality, perfect fit into my Carrier HVAC and the price is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: MGS

customer_reviews.title: Price was excellent. 6 filters came out to about $6 a ...
customer_reviews.text: These were as ordered. They arrive earlier than originally quoted, so that was a bonus. These seem to be as well made as any other filter i have gotten from the big box stores. Price was excellent. 6 filters came out to about $6 a piece for MERV 12 filters. Great deal! Will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Reds Fan

customer_reviews.title: Okay but seem to restrict flow
customer_reviews.text: They fit well. Feel well built and firm and good price and seem to filter alot and fast but they do seem to restrict air flow likely resulting in the blower/furnace overworking.
customer_reviews.author: Scorpio

customer_reviews.title: Almost half the cost of Home Depot
customer_reviews.text: I saw these recommended by Wirecutter so I thought I'd give them a try. They seem to work fine and like my headline says, they are much cheaper than the ones I would buy at Home Depot.
customer_reviews.author: RVS053063

customer_reviews.title: Did I Get What I Paid For?
customer_reviews.text: My issue with these filters is only that I have no way to tell if I got the level of filtering I paid for. I paid extra for the MERV 12 because I specifically want to filter out particulates. The filters came in a Nordic Pure box but there is no other wrapping or labeling, no paperwork, and absolutely nothing written on the filters themselves. No brand name, no model number, no ratings, nothing. Plain, blank white. I'm suspicious.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for the money
customer_reviews.text: Dislike: shipped rather poorly. Two were crushed but I reshaped them and managed to use them. Like: These seem to work as well as the big name brand available at the big box stores. We have a lot of pollen in the neighborhood.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick J. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: The MERV 7 is good for my older furnace
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Nordic Pure filters for a few years. The MERV 7 is good for my older furnace. Great filtration, but doesn't restrict air flow too much.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Y.

product_meta.title: Nordic Pure 16x25x1 MERV 12 Pleated AC Furnace Air Filters, 6 Pack, 6 Pack
product_meta.description:
Style:MERV 12| Size:6 PackNordic Pure MERV 12 Pleated AC Furnace Air Filters provide exceptional filtration for both home and commercial environments. Each time air passes through a Nordic Pure pleated furnace air filter, lint, dust, pollen, bacteria, pet dander, dust mites, mold spores, smoke particles, virus carriers, allergens and other contaminants are removed. MERV 12 furnace filters are comparable to HVAC filters with the rating of MPR 1500-1900 or FPR 9. While different companies use different scales to measure the air filter’s efficiency, Nordic Pure chose to follow the industry standard, MERV, as developed by ASHRAE (the American Society of Heating, Refrigeration and Air Conditioner Engineers). No matter the name of the rating, the efficiency of all air filters is rated according to the same criteria as set forth by ASHRAE. Nordic Pure furnace air conditioner filters are manufactured using a heavy duty, moisture resistant beverage board frame. As with all Nordic Pure furnace air conditioner filters, the material is electrostatically charged to attract unwanted particles. The media used will not promote the growth of bacteria or mold on the air filter and is better at trapping airborne particles than fiberglass filters. Our attention to the smallest of details results in a healthier living space. For fresh, clean air in your home and office, it is important to regularly change your AC filter, especially during home improvements. We recommend changing your HVAC furnace filter every 1-3 months, depending on your unique home or office environment. People with pets or those who suffer from allergies should change their A/C air filters more often. Replacing your air filter regularly not only improves indoor air quality, it helps your HVAC unit perform more efficiently. Important Note: Almost all air condition filters have a different Actual Size (the exact dimensions) than Nominal Size (the name) printed on the air conditioning filter. It is best to measure the exact size of your A/C filter and compare it to our Actual Size to be sure your HVAC replacement filter fits!

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Nordic Pure 16x25x1 MERV 12 Pleated AC Furnace Air Filters: Actual Size: 15-1/2-Inch by 24-1/2-Inch by 3/4-Inch. Changing your air filter is the first step in insuring your HVAC system runs at its optimal level this season. Generally, you should change your 4-Inch air filters every 3 to 6 months. Particles in indoor air are measured in microns, which are 1/1000 of a millimeter. A human hair is about 100 microns wide. A MERV 12 Nordic Pure air filter captures airborne particles as small as 0.3 microns! Nordic Pure air filters do not kill germs, however, the filter media does not permit the growth of bacteria or mold. As a result, it is not necessary to add any potentially irritating chemicals to the air filter to kill germs. Nordic Pure air filters are made out of an electro statically-charged synthetic material that draws airborne particulates to it like a magnet. Electrostatic filters help trap airborne particles to protect your family from allergy causing pollen, fine dust, smoke particles, airborne plant spores, bacteria, and some viruses.
feature_bullets: Nominal Size: 16 x 25 x 1, Actual Size: 15 1/2 x 24 1/2 x 3/4 (15.5 x 24.5 x 0.75)
Attracts indoor allergens, dust, pollen and other airborne contaminants.
Hypoallergenic and antimicrobial pleated electrostatic filter material. Lead/Handling Time is 5
Nordic Pure recommends changing 1” air filters every 30-90 days
